description: Add ability to open individual board lists in isolated standalone windows. Provides true single-list focus mode for multi-monitor workflows and task concentration. Route: /list-standalone?boardId=X&listId=Y
goal: Enable users to open a single board list in a dedicated window without the rest of the board, providing maximum focus and supporting multi-monitor workflows where specific lists can be displayed on separate screens
requirements: Create /list-standalone route with Suspense wrapper to prevent hydration flash
Accept boardId and listId query parameters
Display single BoardList component in vertical layout
Reuse existing BoardList component for consistency
Add list header with board context breadcrumb
Support all existing card operations (create, edit, delete)
Implement dropdown-based card movement between lists (no drag and drop in single-list view)
Add 'Open in New Window' menu item to BoardList header menu
Create Electron IPC handler window:openList for desktop app
Update RootClientWrapper STANDALONE_ROUTES array to include /list-standalone
Provide web browser fallback via window.open() for non-Electron environments
out_of_scope: Drag and drop between lists (isolated list has no other lists visible)
Real-time sync between board and list windows
Keyboard shortcuts specific to list view
constraints: Must reuse existing BoardList component without modifications
Must follow same Suspense pattern as boards-standalone to prevent layout flash
Must maintain consistency with existing boards UI/UX
Must work in both Electron and web browser environments
No breaking changes to existing board or list functionality
Must integrate with existing filesystem-based board persistence
